newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-BORDEAUX MIDFIELDER BA TO JOIN AC MILAN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BORDEAUX MIDFIELDER BA TO JOIN AC MILAN.

text.p: Bordeaux's French international midfielder Ibrahim Ba is to join AC Milan next season, sources close to his club said on Wednesday.
The two clubs reached an agreement for a four-year contract and a 45 million francs (around $7.8 million) transfer fee but the deal had yet to be finalised, the sources said.
Ba joined Bordeaux last year from Le Havre. He enjoyed a successful season, helping his club end fourth in the league and playing his first three matches for the national team.
French coach Aime Jacquet included him in his squad of 22 for the Tournoi de France four-team tournament starting on June 3.
"I'm relieved that everything has been settled before the Tournoi de France," he said. "That will allow me to be more relaxed while playing for France."
The Dakar-born Ba said he was aware that it would be tough for him to become a first choice player at AC Milan.
"I realise that it will not be easy but I'm looking forward to it," he said. "It's a dream come true."
The powerful and gifted Ba had received offers from other leading European clubs including Barcelona and Arsenal.
